avalancheActivity.comment: Snowpack is mostly stable. In some places in the high alpine regions, especially on fresh snowdrift accumulations of blown snow, a small, clustered Avalanche can be triggered under higher loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The danger of Avalanche is low. Be careful in fresh Snowdrift accumulations!

snowpackStructure.comment:
There is little snow, and the peaks and ridges are in some places blown bare.  The Sunny slopes below about 2000 m are also dry. Higher up, there is some new snow on old snow.
A crust has formed on the surface of the snowpack, which supports the weight of a pedestrian. In the high alpine regions, weak layers may be present in the old snow cover.
Up to 10 cm of dry snow fell on such a surface on Wednesday. It snowed with a strong NE wind which built up small drifts.

tendency.highlights: It will clear up overnight on Friday, and Friday will be sunny and slightly warmer. There will be a stronger E wind. The danger of avalanches will remain similar.

weatherForecast.comment:
It will be cloudy and foggy at first, gradually decreasing during the day.
NE winds will blow, easing during the day.

avalancheActivity.comment: Snowpack is mostly stable. In some places in the high alpine regions, especially on fresh drifts of blown snow, a small, clustered Avalanche can be triggered under higher loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The danger of Avalanche is low. Be careful in fresh Snowdrift accumulations!

snowpackStructure.comment:
There is little snow, and the peaks and ridges are in some places blown bare.  The Sunny slopes below about 2000 m are also dry. Higher up, there is some new snow on old snow.
A crust has formed on the surface of the snowpack, which supports the weight of a pedestrian. In the high alpine regions, weak layers may be present in the old snow cover.
Up to 10 cm of dry snow fell on such a surface on Wednesday. It snowed with a strong NE wind which built up small drifts.

tendency.highlights: Friday night will clear everywhere, with sunny and slightly warmer skies on Friday. There will be a stronger E wind. The danger of avalanches will remain similar.

weatherForecast.comment:
On the coastal side of the Alps, it will be sunny in the morning. Elsewhere it will be cloudy and foggy at first, gradually decreasing during the day.
It will be around -5 °C at 1500 m and -8 °C above 2000 m. The wind will blow from the NE and weaken during the day.

avalancheActivity.comment: New fallen snow may spontaneously fall in small creeping patches on the steepest meadows. Snowdrift accumulations formed by the increased NE wind in meadows will be vulnerable to additional load - in some places, a small kložast avalanche is possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A quarter metre of New fallen snow - be careful on steep meadows!

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to 20 cm of snow fell on the ground, mainly in Kobansko, Pohorje and Halo. Up to 10 cm more snow will fall by mid-day on Thursday.
Snowdrift accumulations are expected due to strong NE winds.

tendency.highlights: It will clear up overnight on Friday, and Friday will be sunny and slightly warmer. There will be a stronger E wind. The danger of avalanches will remain similar.

weatherForecast.comment: It will be cloudy and foggy, with occasional snow showers. NE winds will blow at 1500 m, easing during the day.
